Great pub food and atmosphere.  Outdoor seating is nice, but the 3rd street side can be noisy due to industrial sounds and feel of hospital.  I almost always get stuffed chicken (stuffed with asparagus) which comes with roasted red peppers, mashed potatoes and a great sauce.  You wont be disappointed.  Others I've been with there say their dishes were good, but not great so dont expect the world, it's pub food afterall

For the best burger in Hoboken: come here.Came on a Friday night at 7pm and was quickly seated outside. The burgers (cooked medium) were prepared perfectly (cheap Hoboken bars love to overcook their meat) and topped with a generous amount of cheese. For $2, you can upgrade to the Parmesan truffle fries. They were crispy and loaded with Parmesan.Service was ok - our waters were only refilled once during the 1-hour meal.  But otherwise, our meals came quickly, and when you are hungry on a Friday evening, that's the real accomplishment.

This restaurant is much better than the typical bar and restaurant in Hoboken.  It's a little far from washington but I like that distance.  Definitely an older scene  I recommend the bloomfield sandwich and stuffed chicken.  Love the wine selection as well.  Love even more the truffle fries topped with delicate flakes of parm.  Yum.  I also like that the menu changes seasonally.

This is my go to spot. Whenever i am hungry i think of Zaks. They are a guarantee for an awesome meal and great atmosphere. Mark and Sheila are wonderful people who have employed an special staff. Ask for John or Karl when your there and they will make sure you are well taken care of. Also check out their daily specials, they are dynomiteeee!!

I work next door at Hoboken University Medical Center so I come here about once a month for lunch or dinner. There are restaurants in all directions but this is always my go-to place because I'm consistently impressed by the food and enjoy the ambiance.

We really enjoy Zack's, especially for Sunday brunch.  Very cute atmosphere and a nice menu.  Food is always good. Service is super SLOW, so do not go if you are in a rush of have no patience in general.

The following review is based on a rainy Sunday AM experience, but...Beautiful classic interior, friendly and humble bartender, and best of all, some first-rate beers on tap here. Sweet Action, Arrogant Bastard, Fin du Monde, and I saw at least another 3-4 I would have tried had I had more time.Will be back!

As far as brunch goes, this place is a solid 3.5 stars, but as I've been here a dozen times and really have never had a bad experience, I'll round it up to 4 stars. Omlettes are reliable, and they serve their breakfasts with a nice combo of regular and sweet potato hash's.
Mediocre food and expensive prices. Cobb salad was half a head of iceberg lettuce on a plate. Salmon was nothing to write home about.

I ordered a Tequila Vodka & Soda with lime juice....my drink was bright green and too sweet to drink! i also ordered the mescalin salad which was delicious except the avocado was total rubber. I understand Avocados are fickle, but I was very disappointed.

Place is nice, prices were reasonable, food was good, but nothing to write home about. It's a nice little casual spot that feels more like a restaurant than bar, which is a plus.They did a good job pricing their menu because any more expensive and I don't think this place would be worth returning.

I come here every couple months wanting it to be something it's not. Getting the first glass of wine is never a problem but I try to hold in my need to walk out while waiting for a second glass. Even a little banter with the bartenders might be nice as I'm a single woman. My bill tonight was $75 in about and hour and a half and the bartender can't even look at me in the eye. The prices are too high to not feel taken care of. By the way I'm still waiting for the bartender to take my check so I can get out of here and drink cheaper down the street!!!

I have a new perspective on Zack's today...Last Sunday a friend and I enjoyed brunch there (quite good, by the way).  I noticed that they had notification of being closed on Thanksgiving to serve Thanksgiving dinner to local people who are in need.  This note mentioned that they could use volunteers.  Fast forward to today, Thanksgiving Day.  I spent a good four hours with the owner, management, and staff of Zack's helping to feed many, many less fortunate individuals and families.  These people are AWESOME. And they apparently serve a mean T-day dinner.  There is nothing better than a fantastic neighborhood restaurant that not only cares about their clientele but also cares about their community and shows it with gestures like this.  I am unbelievably thankful for the opportunity to participate in this day with the Zack's team.  Happy Thanksgiving y'all!

Have come to Zack's for dinner and for brunch.  Really good spot in midtown hoboken with impeccable service and delicious food.  Ive been here twice for breakfast and get the eggs benedict, french toast with bananas and creme and their coffee which is awesome and unlimited and also get at least 1 mimosa with freshly queezed OJ.  The outdoor seating is cool but a little too noisy. For dinner I think i was cheating that night and we had the truffle fries (love me some black truffles), nachos, crab cakes and split the brisket blend burger which was amazing.  I def recommend coming here.. its hoboken so parking is non existent unless you get there early before dinner hours or early before brunch hours but most walk or take public transportation. the only downfall is that it gets packed very quickly and they tend to give tables to people who are waiting but not physically in the room most of the time.

MY go to place in Hoboken for a consistently great dinner. Their Brisket blend burger by far is the best burger I have had in Hoboken. Chicken entrees are consistently fresh and flavorful. nice outdoor sitting space and inside setting is nice and comforting as well. overall, a great place to grab dinner with friends / family and come back satisfied.
One of Hoboken's hidden treasures! Absolutely love this restaurant - cute ambiance and romantic - had the salmon for dinner and it was amazing!

Great spot for simple, yet delicious food. Stumbled upon this place while walking around, and pleased to discover how cozy it felt inside. Waitstaff was attentive but not overbearing, and didn't mind that we nursed glasses of wine while chatting. We ordered a few different things and everything was delicious.

This is by far the best restaurant I have visited in Hoboken. The shepherd's pie was delicious, and the brownie a la mode I had for dessert was delightful. The service was also on point. I just wish they offered a basket of bread before the meal. Other than that it was perfect.
Came here for brunch.. The atmosphere is really nice... I ordered the breakfast burrito which was great! My friends got the beef brisket burger and it was soo good! The fries were amazing too!
Love this place!  Great food at a reasonable price.  Not a loud drunken dive bar.  This is another local neighborhood gem that caters to couples.   Warm atmosphere, great service and a relaxing time.

Food is very good but I recommend sitting at the bar or asking NOT to sit with Diana if you're at a high top or in the dining room.  She's rude and unprofessional and is lucky to have a job with her crap attitude. With check averages of $250 for 3 people to have dinner and drinks, you deserve better service than what she can offer.

I had a good time at Zack's. I would give them a solid 3.5 with a possible extra star potential with a few tweaks. The service was pretty good. It would be nice though if the bus boys didn't have to ask everyone who ordered what-- it should be marked on the ticket or brought out to us by our waiter. Other than this, the waiter was attentive and accommodating. I got 2 appetizers for the table, nachos & calamari. The nachos were fine and so was the calamari but the portions were on the skimpy side for the price. The nachos were shareable but the calamari was for 1 person. I got the brisket blend burger for $14 and it was solid. I would get it again. But I will mention a few downsides. First, the burger was not cooked to order. It was very rare and not medium rare like I ordered. I would probably order medium next time. It was still juicy and delicious.  But it was so juicy that the bottom of bun was soggy when I got it.  Maybe put lettuce on the bottom bun to insulate it from the juice?  The burger with the toppings (cheese, bacon, and roasted tomatoes) was a little big to enjoy everything in one bite. I had to eat with a knife and fork and only portions of each component at a time. It is not date friendly dish either because I was constantly wiping myself with a napkin. And my fries were nubs; I had only a couple of long fries and most were really short that I had to use a fork. Maybe I got the end of the bag? While you could reduce the size of the burger to make it more manageable, at $14 it is getting on the expensive side. Personally, I would reduce the size of the burger but also the $14 price tag. It is also really loud when it gets full. I had a hard time hearing the person next to me. Not much you can do with the acoustics but I have to mention it. Also worth mentioning is the awesome paper towels in the bathroom. I know, I know 'Tony awesome towels?' But they are like cloth. I appreciate a business that spends a little more so the customer feels at home. Some people do notice the little things ;) I will note that most of my constructive criticisms are for Sheila & Mark.  I think both the food and service is very good.  And in the end, I will come again.

Appetizers were really over priced and unappealing. $7 for a french onion soup? We ordered crabmeat dumplings in a five spice dip (?) for $9 which we were really looking forward to. Our best guess is these were purchased from BJs or Trader Joes and most likely microwaved, possibly boiled. For $9 we received 5 small shumai probably about the size of half a thumb. The five spice dipping sauce was described by my partner as water downed soy sauce with chives - definitely no dipping possible, it was just a thin layer of liquid in the bottom of the bowl the shumai sat in, and really just not that good. We ordered a second appetizer to complement this, stuffed sausage and provolone bites. While these tasted ok, again they seemed like they came out of a box from BJs, etc. and the restaurant fried them up and served them with marinara. The marinara tasted like it came out of a can, and was not very good. The bites were ok, except again very small and very expensive for what we ordered. I think it was $9, and again we received five pieces about the size of half my thumb.The entree was good. It seems this restaurant really shines on its main offerings - they are reasonably priced and tasted freshly made and done to order. The other entrees I saw also looked very appetizing.I would go back to Zack's for a good entree - burger and pasta both looked good, and the sense I got was they really focused on entrees but used frozen boxed stuff for the appetizers (except the french onion soup, that looked delicious and filling too). Unfortunately the cost of the appetizers was such a turnoff that it really made the restaurant undesirable. The $9 appetizers were close to horrible in light of the price (for $3, they would have been ok), and really turns you off from enjoying a well done $15 entree.The ambience was good. The service was good. The wine was half price and also good. JUST AVOID THE APPETIZERS!

I've spent my last two New Years and Mother's Day 2014 here, so I guess you could say I like this place -- a lot! Great food, nice atmosphere. I love the Truffle Oil Fries and Stuffed Chicken. Of course, you can't go wrong with a burger either. But best of all, I highly recommend the "secret menu item," the Balsamic Chicken. It used to be on the regular menu and while it's no longer there, you can always request it.

Great food, 90 minute beer, not so great of service. We knew of this place for a few months and my roommates and myself decided to come in for food and drinks. We had to seat ourselves because of a not so great greeting and then decided to move to the bar after 5 minutes of being snared at because we were unsure of whether the waitress wanted us to sit in her section or no. For a bar with great potential, I would expect better service. Not one employee smiled or seemed thankful to us for the 2 hours we ate and drank. I would like to come back, especially for the beer and food selection but feel like if your face isn't recognized as a regular you might not like it.

Okay, so I am really upset to give a negative review to Zacks. I've been a loyal customer for 5 years, and have always enjoyed their food and atmosphere. Before today I would have given 4 stars. But today, when we decided to bring our 14mo. old son, we had a very different experience. When we arrived we asked for a highchair, which was no problem. They gave us a table with room, which immediately sends a "child friendly" message. Then we asked for a kids menu. No kids menu. Okay. So, I asked if any menu options could be made into kids meals. The waiter said that anything could basically be made for him. I made my selection, and ordered him a "kids portion of french toast." The waiter replied "well, we only have the one size." Meaning, he could only serve us the regular size portion from the menu with the regular price. I'm not cheap, and I don't mind spending $ on good food. But a 14mo old does not need a full portion of french toast. I asked if it was possible to make him a smaller portion bc he didn't need the full size. "no" was the response I got. Great. So I shared mine with him, not a big deal.My issue with Zacks is that Hoboken is a very child friendly town. If you have highchairs, you are saying that it is okay to bring children to your restaurant. If you don't have a kids menu, you should offer kid sized portions or, like other restaurants in town, give a free side of food for the kid. How much could 1/2 slice of bread dipped in egg cost? After all, make the kid happy, keep the parents coming back! (Bin 14 does this and it is incredibly smart!). Anyways, sorry Zacks. We won't be coming back anytime soon... which is quite sad bc we used to visit you weekly.
Brisket blend burger is fantastic!  Cool atmosphere just  off the beaten path.  Just go!
The truffle oil fries are must for an appetizer. I thoroughly enjoyed the lamb penne for dinner. It was bursting with great flavors, including a nice little serving of fresh mozzarella on top.

Solid brunch fare, but slow service.I had the sausage egg scramble, which was basically an open-faced breakfast sandwich on two halves of an English muffin, covered in melty American cheese. It was a little dry, but overall enjoyable. I added a side of home fries for an additional $3. The home fries were a mix of white and sweet potatoes, and despite needing some salt and pepper, were pretty tasty. Coffee was strong and hot, which is all I wanted.Prices seemed a bit high for what we received (but only a bit), and the service was definitely "laid back." We never received coffee refills, and I had to explicitly ask for the check after our table had been cleared. Our table was also incredibly wobbly--I should have asked to move, so I will accept some blame here.Would I go back? Sure, but I'd also be happy to try someplace else first.

I came here for a date night with my boyfriend, and we both loved it. I ordered the stuffed chicken, and it was amazing, especially with the five-spice sauce. My boyfriend ordered one of the seafood specials and loved it, as well. Can't wait to go back.

This place is great. I am not saying that because I am always there, but because it's true. The environment is just right and the food is always tasty. The waitresses are welcoming and attractive and the bartenders are funny. I feel at home. The meatballs on Mondays are my third favorite to the brisket burger, and infamous stuffed chicken.

Our go-to casual brunch in Hoboken! The best bloody marys in town plus everything we have had is delicious! My hubs only orders the breakfast burrito while I try to alternate dishes. We keep saying we need to come back for dinner. We like sitting inside or outside and their coffee is AMAZING! My puppy is a huge fan of the breakfast potatoes too (we all are, actually - especially the sweet potatoes!). Portions are generous without being wasteful and if you have folks to share with, the lemon ricotta pancakes make am amazing brunch dessert!!!

Went here for brunch on a Sunday afternoon, and got the french toast. The food was great - delicious french toast, a good amount of maple syrup, and I loved the bananas and almonds atop the toast. I also got a side of bacon, which was crunchy without being overcooked. Reasonable prices, cool and relaxed ambiance inside, and delicious brunch. Hope to return for dinner sometime.

An underutilized gem with the BEST CHICKEN DISHES OF ALL TIME.Seriously.My boyfriend cannot get enough of the Stuffed Chicken (roast chicken breast with five-spice sauce, asparagus, mashed potatoes, and red peppers) and the Balsamic Chicken (sauteed chicken breast with white wine and balsamic vinegar over fresh mozzarella and tomatoes). I think he even tried to bribe the kitchen for the recipe, but they wouldn't fork it over.There aren't many non-meat dishes on the menu for me, but the salads are creative and delicious, like the Pear and Avocado Salad (pine nuts, cranberries, and goat cheese dressing). With its tin ceiling and beautiful bar area, the restaurant is homey and comfortable.I'm sure I'll be back many, many times.
Amazing food and great staff! These people know how to treat a guest. They are very attentive and kind but not overwhelming. Love this place!

I've been a fan of Zack's for at least 10 years. When word got out they had a new menu, i had to check things out. Let's talk Burgers. They have a Brisket Burger with pastrami bacon on the new menu. Now THIS is a Burger. Most places in Hoboken honestly can't cook a burger, or the meat isn't high quality....well - Zack's hit it out of the park. The burger was huge, very juicy and extremely flavorful. I was in heaven. Instead of fries, i asked for some kind of vegetable - the giant asparagus spears were ridiculously good - smoky, a bit of spice, perfectly seasoned, very tasty for a green veg.The chicken main course is also very good - crispy, and served with a brown sauce that just begs for bread to be dipped in...I also sampled their Ribs appetizer, and it fell short - just lacked the right texture, didn't have any char on the outside...But all in all....i will be back to eat more of Zack's, this is a neighborhood gem.

I had a delicious arugula salad with roasted chicken but my boyfriend had a lamb/pasta dish that was mostly fat and sliced unevenly so it wasn't cooked properly. The sauce tasted like it was from a jar. Very pricey for small portions buy you have to expect that for this area. Wouldn't go back except for that salad.
Zack's serves consistently excellent food and they really do offer the best gin and tonic ever.  Our go to place for lunch, brunch, and dinner.

So good! A coworker recommended this place to take my parents to dinner while they were visiting. The atmosphere is great and they are one of the few restaurants in Hoboken that take a reservation. Our table wasn't quite ready so we sat at the bar and had a drink. Really cool old touches that have been kept as they've renovated the place. Our meals were great and there is quite a variety of choices on the menu. They have wings-pasta-tuna-etc. I'll be back!
Best burger around. This is my go to place for a delicious burger and yummy fries. Good beer selection as well. The decor is unique and I like the ambiance.
I ordered the short ribs last Wednesday and had diarrhea for 3 days. Not sure what is going on with their kitchen staff and if food was not cooked or stored properly. Would not recommend this entree.

Hidden gem in Hoboken. Cozy spot with great food and beer selection. The atmosphere at Zack's is typically low key and quiet, it's rarely packed. They also have a large outdoor seating area. Recommend their burgers and brunch food.

Brace yourself...It's a womp womp review on the brunch:Stumbled upon this place wandering around Hoboken with my roomie on a Saturday morning.  The spot wasn't too crowded and we got a 4 person table.  The waitress was a bit novice and I felt at any moment the coffee or water was going to fly everywhere.  On top of that she picked up the water glass by the brim--I was kind of grossed out (that's where your mouth goes duh)Anyway, got the veggie omelette with parmesan cheese in it and it was underwhelming. Bland flavors that were barebones normal and unexciting. Probably the best part of the meal was the coffee.  This place looks like it changes at nighttime though but probably in need of a total menu revamp and decor facelift

After seeing Mumford and Sons down at Pier A, along with 10,000 other people, my companion and I were hard-pressed to find anywhere in Hoboken to sit and have a quiet drink.  We wandered up and down Washington, despairing as bar after bar was hopelessly full of rowdy people, so we decided to make a left and see what we might find.  In the distance, down a quiet side street, we saw the soft glow of Zack's Oak Bar & Restaurant and eagerly went inside.  It was like another world, free of the madness of Hoboken's main drag and was the perfect place to sit for an hour and drink a quality beer.I'd love to come back and try their food, but I'd go back just for the cozy, casual vibe and clutch mood lighting.

A great little spot in Hoboken off the beaten path! It definitely attracts a local crowd since it's not on Washington Street. I've gotten their burger before and liked it, and on my most recent trip, I got the balsamic chicken. It was a huge portion of chicken chopped Chinese style, served in a delicious sauce. I would highly recommend that dish if you're checking out Zack's. The dining room is tiny, but it's the perfect spot if you're looking for a great meal in a truly neighborhood restaurant.

Since Ted & Jo's isn't around any longer, this spot is the next closest thing, in terms of ambiance, vibe, prices, decor and service.Its probably because its the same owners.I could eat their juicy burgers with a pint every day.  Its just that type of resto/bar.  Its like home away from home.If you want to chill with a few friends at a spot with zero pretentiousness, hit it up.

I absolutely love this place. Default option on any night for dinner has been Zacks. Me and my boo think about their spicy vodka sauce salmon and perfectly cooked shrimp over the best angel hair pasta in hoboken, from time to time. Their perfect gin really is perfect since I don't even like gin on a regular night. They once had this mussels with spicy marinara sauce and that was the dish that had us come back the second time. The angle hair pasta was what kept us coming back. But last night we had their pear and avocado salad and how buttery can a salad get without the butter. Gotta warn you that sometimes the appetizer menu sells you the wonton on top of a salad but when you get it. It's really a salad with four wontons on the side. We just don't order that ever again but it's still yummy. Just not for the price. Brownie a la mode with Choco chips a top is the way to go. End rant. It's about time I wrote a review for this beloved hoboken restaurant of mine. I live by yelp so more pictures would be helpful but I get why as their menu changes often.

Good food, great service, overall a great place to take a date, but beware of the following:-Its small so you have to have to get a table especially if you go later for dinner.-The wines are expensive so if you or your date is a wine drinker, the bill can rack up fast.However, if you can avoid the wine list, this is a great place to go.

Brunch review:I remember we came here on January 1st - for Sunday brunch right after New Years.  The place is fine enough, but nothing memorable at all, despite it being the first meal of a New Years.Decor isn't impressive, but it's homey enough for a pub feel with high seats and all that.  Although it is nicer in the summer when they have their outdoor seating.  Food was underwhelming and nothing to write home about, although, again another caveat, I hear (and have seen as I walk back home on 3rd street) that it looks and smells way better at nighttime.  Service was nice but I haven't come back, specially when O'Nieals is the same distance.

Great burger and great fries nice place for a quick lunch. We came here during luch hours and the place was quite, we got a nice table outside. We had a great time with the server, and the food came out pretty quick.

Friendly staffDog friendly in outside areaFood service was fastZack's Chicken - tender meat, veggies were a little too salty. Just okBalsamic Chicken - yummy!Overall, food was good, but nothing spectacular

Zack's is my favorite spot in Hoboken. The bartenders are great, the owners are friendly, and the food and drinks are awesome!I get the cold Rotelli every chance I get. They used to have grilled cheese on the menu (which they should totally bring back), but even though it's now gone, when I ask for it, they'll make it for me anyway.They also have a great beer selection which they rotate throughout the year. Also, (and this might just be me), I really value bathroom upkeep so I'm putting this in here too. They keep the bathrooms spotless and smelling great. Martha Stewart would be jealous.Also, to the people complaining that there's no kids menu/food... what??Sometimes mom and dad want to go out for a nice meal and a beer. I get it. But just because Zack's can accommodate your child with a highchair doesn't mean this is Chuck E Cheese. They serve beer and wine and adult meals. If you want your kid to eat there with you, bring some Cheerios in a Ziploc or accept that they're going to have to eat off your plate. Don't be a pain and ask the establishment to make special kids' menu with smaller portions at a lower price. If you do, you're the rude one, not them.

I'm conflicted on this review, but landed on 3 stars since the food really wasn't wonderful (and, let's face it, that's a big reason why we go to restaurants!).  Here's the breakdown: Food: 2.5 stars (I've only been for brunch).The menu is limited but has lots of the usuals. All of our dishes were served with decent potatoes/ sweet potatoes.I ordered eggs benedict, which is often a good test for a chef's attention to details and true culinary skill. Unfortunately, it fell down on several levels. The english muffin was cold and not toasted. The poached eggs were overcooked - not at all the gooeyness that you're looking for. Lastly, the hollendaise (sp?) sauce was just not good at all... bland and rather unpleasant. I actually scrapped the sauce off. My friends got an omelet and the "special," which was an open-faced egg sandwich with arugala and cheddar and kielbasa if my memory serves me correctly. They were both much happier with their dishes, although the kitchen was out of the spicy sauce for the special.Coffee was just okay as well.Decor: 4.75 stars.Comfortable, lovely, clean. Kind of what you'd be looking for when going to brunch with your girls or even having a casual glass of wine after work.Service: 3.5 stars. Friendly and accommodating. I loved that they didn't rush us to order, eat, pay or when we were sitting and chatting. However, it was rather awkward at times and, even though the restaurant was not even half full and there were plenty of tables that were more isolated, they sat people at the table directly next to us - including their children (next to 3 women who were obviously not discussing kid-friendly topics!).

I enjoy the decor of Zacks. Its a small and has an intimate feel, good date spot. If you go at night, the candles flickering lights reflect off of the dark oak, its a beautiful sight. The food in my opinion is much better at night as well. I had the stuffed chicken and its very good. I was worried that the asparagus would make it bitter but it blended perfectly. I visited Zacks for brunch as well and was a bit disappointed. I mean, the brunch menu isn't all that complicated, simple stuff, eggs benedict, pancakes, omelettes etc. I ordered the buttermilk pancakes but they were lackluster which was disappointing, how can you go wrong with pancakes? So, go here for dinner not brunch. Happy Eating!

My parents work in the hospital across the street so we go to Zack's pretty often. The food is consistently good. The steak sandwich is awesome and they make some of the best duck dishes I have ever had. Staff is really friendly. It's enjoyable to sit down with my family for a meal and grab a burger and beers to watch a game.

Perhaps I am biased, having spent one glorious summer of my youth in Hoboken subletting an apartment directly above Zack's (or "McLaren's", as it became affectionately known amongst my friends). I will say this--having an unlimited supply of booze and bar food not 30 feet beneath you is categorically as good as it gets. Having Zack's Oak Bar & Restaurant 30 feet beneath you--if it's possible, even BETTER than as-good-as-it-gets.I went to Zack's as often as one might imagine that someone who lived above a bar would, and not once did a single morsel pass my lips that I did not enjoy immensely.Their burgers (and pretty much all of their "pub grub") are a non-greasy, fresh-tasting, classed-up version of their grubbier counterparts. I also recall Zack's having pretty awesome nachos and margaritas for a non-Mexican restaurant. And I distinctly remember downing an entire plate of their stuffed chicken in maybe 5 minutes. The bartenders, waitstaff, and even the regular patrons are down-to-earth and friendly. The neighborhood is quaint and quirky, making the outdoor seating area a perfect alternative to the high traffic and noise of Washington Street. If you're looking for a lower-key, higher-class joint for an evening of dinner and drinks with friends in Hoboken, you can't do better than Zack's.

Just got back from Zacks.  Here's the rundown...Ordered stuffed chicken based on yelp word on the street and damn, that was mighty tasty (4 star status).  The only issue was that I brought an appetite and was seriously considering a second order.  Instead, I audibled into appetizers.  I ordered some sort of meat and cheese fried dough along with calamari, both of which were mediocre.  On the stuffed chicken alone I probably would have went with a 4 star rating despite the meal being light, but the mediocre appetizers and 80 dollar tab for me and my roommate equates to a 3 star rating.  Next time I may skip the appetizers and double up on stuffed chicken to bulk up.  Winter's Coming.

Solid casual neighborhood grill and bar (in that order).Simple but well executed menu and great service and a comfortable dining room and plenty of outdoor seating.  Pretty good daily specials and excellent, fresh salads (cobb eats like a hearty meal).  They're supposed to have great burgers so the fact I've been a handful of times and haven't yet had one probably means they've got some appetizing alternatives.

I had dinner at Zack's last night for the first and last time.  The food was pretty good, but I have never seen service like this.  Our waitress ( short with tattoo on chest area ) rushed us in and out of the restaurant so quickly I honestly created an account on yelp just to write this.  She literally stood and waited at the table for me to sign the check.  I have never seen anything like this before.  For anybody else looking to sit down and enjoy a meal without being rushed, I recommend you take your business elsewhere in Hoboken.

Zack's is a great neighborhood bar/restaurant.  The food is always good - the burger is solid, the short ribs are great and the stuffed chicken is excellent.  There is a very good beer list with rotating taps and a good selection of craft beers.  The staff are always great as well.  My wife had a party to celebrate a friend's engagement and had nothing but great things to say about everyone at Zack's!

Had been to the bar once and loved the atmosphere so we decided to have our friend's birthday dinner there (Monday night).  Since it was during the week it wasn't crowded but I could see it being cramped on the weekends.  The food was excellent, one of the best meals I've had out in Hoboken.   Everyone in our group (party of 9) enjoyed their meal. We are already talking about trying to go back so we can try more of the menu.

I've heard so many people reference Zack's as  being a really good restaurant - I tried it for the first time this past weekend and I can't say I was impressed. The pears in my salad were hard as rocks (if pears aren't in season, maybe try to come up with a seasonal salad instead?) and my boyfriend said his pork chop was extremely tough (we had to stop somewhere on the way home so he could get a slice of pizza instead). Also, the cocktails. Why did I spend $12 on the "Perfect" Gin and Tonic when it tasted the same as a G&T with well gin from any crappy dive bar? It was really disappointing. On a positive note, its a pretty space and very well kept. Also, I've heard the chicken with asparagus is really good (but I honestly can't say I'll be back to try it)
The brisket blend burger on the brunch menu is excellent. My wife ordered the NY strip sandwich, which was also very good.  Nice atmosphere, very accommodating to children. Definitely going back.

Great brunch spot with a calm, laid back atmosphere, pleasant wait staff, nice ambiance and plenty of comfort food. Their homemade muffins are my kryptonite.  They even toast them and give them to you with butter and prepare special flavors that fit the season like apple cinnamon, pumpkin, or cranberry. For those on a diet - or looking to pair a lowfat meal with a sinful muffin - the salads are delicious as are the omelets, both egg white and regular. Very nice place to go if you just want a nice, relaxing, delicious traditional breakfast,

Showed up with 3 adults, a rambunctious toddler, and a newborn. They accommodated us outside no problem.We all had brunch and it was delicious. Even the toddler liked her food, which she rarely does. I'm going to have to go back for lunch though. The descriptions of the burger and stuffed chicken make me drool.Waitress was friendly and attentive.

A really nice spot just off the beaten track in downtown Hoboken. There's a nice warm ambiance, perfect for cold fall and winter evenings, but also a fun and active bar. The food is quite good (especially the mac & cheese appetizer), and the portions are generous.We had to wait a bit for our table and were still completely satisfied with our visit!

Walk in and get immediately greeted by friendly people and great atmosphere.  They just added Oyster Bay to the wine list. We both got that, she got the steak, and I had the Tuna steak with lentils and asparagus. Both very good. It feels like you are just hanging out in your living room. In fact, we had two rounds and would have stayed for a third, but it started getting crowded and we wanted to give our seat up. Overall great experience. We will definitely be back soon!

I went to Zack's on a Saturday night at 7 for dinner with my Fiance.  I've been here before, and its a cozy neighborhood spot with great food.  However, the service leaves something to be desired.The cod, a special for the evening sounded good, so I asked the server to check for me if it was gluten free.  I also inquired about the goat cheese dressing for a salad that I was having as an appetizer.  Instead of saying "Sorry, this is not gluten free, but we can pan sear the fish with no flour, or sorry, this is not gluten free, but these 3 entrees are"  would have been helpful.  Instead I just got a simple "no" to both of my inquiries.  I ended up with the grilled salmon which was spectacular, and balsamic vinegar for my salad.  My Fiance enjoyed his stuffed chicken as well.I asked for my water to be re-filled twice, however it sat empty on the table until we left, never being re-filled.  When the check came, we were charged $13 for an $8 glass of wine.  While never apologizing, our server said "Oh, I guess I can get this changed."  Um yes, please get this changed and charge us the correct amount.While the food is good enough for us to return, don't expect much from the service.
Special was blackened swordfish and was delicious. Great meal for a reasonable price  good atmosphere and good service
Big selection of food and drinks and has a good, relaxed atmosphere inside

Zack's is that cozy, homey neighborhood restaurant/bar.  Great place to grab dinner or drinks and a snack.  They actually try to make their salads more creative than just leaves and a protein.  Hubby gets the nachos and they are always loaded.

Sadly, Zack's changed its menu in January. Recently went there for some of their delicious food and was sadly surprised to see their heavily reduced choice of menu items. Food was nothing to write home about - hamburgers were raw and side salads were like Dole bagged lettuce. I don't know why they changed - it was fantastic just the way it was.

Came with the family on a Sunday early evening.  Their regular menu wasn't anything special but we all ordered off of their daily specials and enjoyed our meal.  It's a nice place if you want a low-key meal.

This place has a couple of dishes that I am a huge fan of (stuffed chicken, brisket burger, wings) but I to be honest I've also had more than one item that I wasn't impressed with (nachos, the willow sandwich, plus some others that I can't remember right now).I know that there's always a dish that I can go back to and thoroughly enjoy but in my mind, this place is priced pretty steep for what you're getting, to me $25 should get you more than a beer and a sandwich.

My sister and I ended up at Zack's Oak Bar & Restaurant for brunch this morning.. and it was delicious! We both ordered off their specials menu: One omelet with mozz cheese, basil, and broccoli... and one order of banana almond pancakes. Service was a little slow, but that may have been because we were so hungry! Our waitress was extremely friendly, helpful and sweet. We also had FRESH SQUEEZED OJ, which is such a rarity now a days. Very delicious! I would go back again any time of day for a bite to eat here!
nice little place.had some goat chesse wontons which were awesome.def come back.

Zack's is my favorite neighborhood restaurant. I love coming where everyone knows my name. The service is super friendly and the stuffed chicken is to die for. My only problem with this place is that they took the balsamic chicken off the menu. It is seriously delish. Wassup wit dat? If only they would only add it back, my life would be complete. Go to Zack's. It's amaze.

I give this place 3.5 stars.  it has a lot of competition with Onieal's and Three A's and the other Bar & Grills up on Washington street, but it has the BEST BURGER IN HOBOKEN in my humble opinion.  Went here for the first time a few days ago and was pleasantly surprised.  The Oak bar is really beautiful and gives this place a classy feel to it.  I like that there is ample seating at the bar as well as tables around the bar, because I like to eat AT or NEAR the bar, not in the dining area (ahem, take note Three As).They have a good selection of draft beers (stella, blue moon etc) and they actually have a good selection of wine by the glass!  I got a Malbec - not a lot of places give you Malbecs by the glass.  There were so many good things on the menu, it was hard to choose.  But I came out for Burgers and beers, and I stuck to my burger with swiss cheese and sauteed onions.  My husbone got the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and green beans.  A table of girls next to us had a feast of appetizers - we stalked every dish that went to their table - wings (my husbone drooled over them), crab cakes.Anyways, I was really happy that the husbone got the meatloaf, because i'm a sucker for meatloaf and this dish did not disappoint.  Perfect flavor, moist.  The mashed potatoes were creamy and good, but I, personally, like mine lumpy with pototo bits in it.  Green beans were perfectly buttered but did not overwhelm the veggies.Now my burger.  This was probably the BEST BURGER I'VE HAD IN HOBOKEN!!!  I've had a lot of burgers too.  Oneil's used to be my favorite, but Zack's brioche bun took the top spot!  I like my burgers medium rare to medium (a touch of pink in the middle of the burger won't give me salmonella!).  They cooked it perfectly.  Swiss cheese melted and dripping around the burger, piles of sauteed sweet onions on top.  It was messy and it was good.  The brioche bun made this burger taste even better.  It was subtle, soft yet chewy, and allowed the burger taste to take the show.I was fully satisfied and stuffed to the gills with this delectable burger.  I will definitely frequent this place for my burger fix in hoboken.
Yep this place is still awesome.I tried the Stuffed Chicken. YumEverything on the menu is good. It's official.

It was my favorite restaurant in Hoboken from the moment I first tried it. I loved the burgers and the nachos, but my last visit was very disappointing. Both, my beef burger and my partner's turkey burger were extremely salty. I'll probably give Zack's another try, but for now I'll be trying other restaurants in the area.

The butternut squash soup tasted old, the crab in it very fishy and undercooked. My salad was ok. Brisket burger was good, but nothing here to write home about. If the waitress took our soup that we didnt touch off the bill I would have given 3 stars. Great for their sausage and provolone bites and a swig of scotch or whiskey, though.

The menu, in concept, is elevated above the typical pub fare.  However, the execution is just mediocre.  Whether it is the small portions, or the innovative items like the brisket blend burger lacking significant flavor, the food falls short.As far as the beer selection goes, however, this is a great find.

Went here for the first time last night and wasn't disappointed. It is in a nice location off the busy hustle and bustle of Washington Street. We sat outside which is always a plus for restaurants during the warmer months and unlike some places that tend to forget about their outside diners, the service was great. We had the mussels to start which were very tasty and the garlic bread that came with them was a nice touch. For dinner my boyfriend had the blended brisket burger which I didn't try but he said it was delicious. I had the Cobb salad and while it was delicious, the presentation left something to be desired. It is served with a chunk of iceberg lettuce topped with cheese, avocado and bacon, half a hard boiled egg on the side, and a piece of grilled chicken on the side as well. I had to cut everything up myself and mix it all together. I felt that was a little strange but the salad was so good that it was worth the work. I'd definitely go back, especially while it's still warm out so we can take advantage of the outdoor seating.

I love Zack's, mainly bc of the location (I live steps away) and the service. Every hostess, bartender and server I've had was VERY friendly and warm. The food is pretty good - not amazing, but pretty good. I've had brunch - limited menu, but tasty. Somewhat basic dinners, but good for a neighborhood place. The wine selection is small, but a good beer list.Overall the food/bev is a B, but the atmosphere (super laid back, but well maintained & cozy - not at all a dumpy pub) and service make me come frequently.

Walking into Zack's on a Friday night, I found a moderately lit - oak-y bar/restaurant. We were seated at a great table in the back. Food was solid. We got the bruchetta and calamari to start. The only odd part about the bruchetta is its make your own. It comes with crostini on the outside of the pile of tomato, mixed greens, and goat cheese - all drizzled with balsamic. Quite tasty but an odd presentation. Entrees were consistent. I'm normally wary of ordering pasta at american places like this but my friend had the spicy pasta vodka and it didn't disappoint. Anyone that knows me swears I can't order directly off a menu, and well its mostly true. This waiter was great. I got my classic cob salad - no bacon, no red onion - since I "do not dine on swine" and added tomato and carrots - dressing on the side. The order came out exactly the way I wanted it. To his credit, he also recommended a great bottle of wine as well. Other entrees ordered and enjoyed were the steak sandwhich and  filet mignon. We finished our meal with a chocolate molten cake which had a fruity spin on it.

I go to brunch nearly every Sunday, and when I eat with my old roommate, she and I always go to Zack's.  Food is delicious, the staff is really friendly and the decor is warm and cozy.  Most of the food on the brunch menu come with a mix of regular potatoes and sweet potatoes, which is awesome. During the afternoon on Sundays it gets a little rowdy during football season, but there's a room separate from the bar where you can sort of avoid the noise.

Zack's is consistently good, low key spot to have a good burger and some Chimay on tap. Service is always polite; bar and dining area get a little tight weekend nights. Last time I was there I destroyed one of the delicious burgers, they threw on some Avocado and didn't charge me an extra $4 dollars like every other place I go to. Friends got the White Wine Pasta special with the Italian sausage, and really liked it... must be good if 2 petite girls are housing that dish.
Nachos were outstanding and my burger was a perfect medium rare.  However, my fiancée's burger was too well done.  But for that one mistake, I would have given Zack's five stars.

Stuffed chicken lived up to its expectations as predicted on Yelp. However, everything else was regular bar food appetizers and overpriced. I ran up a nice bill and left hungry. Nice looking place, which is why you would come to an oak bar anyway I suppose but it's missing another element to keep me coming back.

I've been here a few times, and I can say that whether you are looking for dinner or just a quick drink, Zack's Oak Bar and Restaurant is a solid choice.I recently went there for dinner.  I sat at the bar and didn't have to wait at all for service.  Their beer selection is pretty diverse (although a bit on the small side) with beers from all over the US as well as abroad.  The liquor selection is impressive, especially in the selection of whiskey.  I ordered the Brisket Blend Burger which was fantastic.  Nice and juicy with tons of flavor.  And served with basil french fries.  To be honest, the basil flavor didn't carry over unless you got a bit of fried basil leaf, but if you did, it was very nice.The atmosphere is comfortable neighborhood with a touch of upscale.  It's not overly loud or raucous, but there is definitely an energy to the place.  The staff were friendly and attentive.Bottom line: a solid bar selection and I have yet to have a better burger in Hoboken.

This is the perfect place to go for a casual evening with friends.   The focal point of the restaurant is the huge oak bar.  When I go, I like to sit at the bar, but they also have tables in the bar area and tables in the back for a more intimate meal.  

The food is sort of a combo of British pub food and American with a twist.   I recommend any of the specials.  If they run out (which they often do) my favorite things on the menu are nachos, crab cakes and the goat cheese and lentil salad.   You can't go wrong with a Zack's burger and I've heard that the Beef Bourgignon is great too.

The prices are totally reasonable, which probably makes this the best food value in town.  It's also a great spot for brunch.

Went there over the weekend and thought I had passed the 'brunch' hour around 3p and was a little disappointed by the fact they were still serving the brunch menu.  I eventually got over it and ordered an open faced filet mignon sandwich which was a little over cooked. My husband ordered a bacon cheeseburger and was very pleased. It was served on a brioche roll and made me envious of his selection.  Next time I go back (and I would) I am going with the  burger!
Had the eggs benny for brunch. Was solid. Sat out side, damn good service. Will come back for more real soon.

Is it only my dear old Filipino father or does yours also tell inane tales about being able to talk to snakes and black magic when anyone who's not immediate family is around? On a happier note, now I know why all those Harry Potter quizzes I used to take told me I was Severus Snape.This "bar with tables" was clearly not the right choice for a night out with the family. Wanting to take an out of town relative to dinner, Momdukes put it on me to choose the place. But not knowing anything about her taste in food, I opened up Yelp, handed her my laptop and let her fingers do the walking. In my defense, she repeatedly said that all she wanted was a salad and some dessert. Nutritional alarms aside, I had no idea where the hell to go with that. So she found Zack's.Hoboken being Hoboken, I stayed in the car with the Dork traversing the neighborhood looking for parking while the rest of them had gone in to be seated. By the time we got there, the calamari and wings were half gone. This is a testament to the parking problem in town and the Dork's paranoia about parking anywhere that might touch a millimeter of a yellow line, not my family's greediness at the dinner table. Not being a wing chic, I can't say anything about them, but the calamari was decent. The menu here is very spartan, as if the management just gave up halfway through. Though I rarely eat red meat, I ended up with the steak. Very salty for me, which is a rarity for me because I rarely complain about things being salty; hence it being a rarity. Of course, I didn't finish it, I never do, so to the Dork it went. Did my cousin have her salad and dessert? Why no she did not, thank you for asking. She enjoyed tons of calamari, wings and tidbits of everyone else's meals. This place was so packed and so loud, it really made me feel claustrophobic in a non-sexy Asian sardine kind of way.

Went to Zack's last night with 3 other people.  The dining area is small / quaint - in a good way.  Separated from the bar area, but well within sight.  It was a Wednesday, so there were only a few other people, and maybe 15 people near the bar.  Waitress was very accommodating in letting us sit there pretty much for an 30 minutes before we even picked up the menus to order.2 burgers1 Cajun chicken sandwich (the Bloomfield)1 Sheppard's pieI ordered one of the burgers (medium rare).  Cooked perfectly.  Bright red center, charred outside.  Brioche bun went very well with the juicy burger.  Highly recommended.  One of the best burgers in Hoboken.  Blue cheese - plentiful, sharp, also accented the burger nicely.I tried a bite of the Cajun chicken sandwich.  Juicy, spicy, seemed very well prepared.Beer selection was limited.  Standard options, one or two microbrews (DFH, arrogant Bastard).In short, I will be coming back here.  Typical bar fare, done very well.

It had been 10 years since my last visit to Zack's, when I lived around the corner.  Walking in, it was much the same.  We started with the Bruchetta, which came with a salad on top and drizzled with a nice balsamic.  It was fantastic.  For entree, I had the Lamb Penne because I hadn't heard of it before and the waitress described it as very tasty.  It was four star quality, but I'm rounding up to five stars due to the attentive, but not overbearing service with quick delivery of each course and the tasty app.  I'll be back again hopefully before another 10 years.
Food was ok. Salads were the highlight. I had the short rib. It was a big portion but found the meat chewy. It was a pricey dinner not sure worth it
Another Hoboken place that I miss.  Good atmoshere and food!
